ygData.subject: Death of Lord Mistmoore
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey all, Just wanted to share with you a sweet kill me and my friends got last night. We were in Mistmoore and out came the lord himself. There were 6 of us. A
ygData.messageBody:
Hey all,


Just wanted to share with you a sweet kill me and my friends got last night.
We were in Mistmoore and out came the lord himself. There were 6 of us. A
level 49 cleric. Level 43 warrior (Me) Level 47 Wizard, level 47 Rogue,
level 49 necro and a level 45 Ranger. We decided why the heck not give him a
try even tho he conned red to everyone in the party. Well it was quite the
battle. By far the craziest i have ever seen. In the end only the Necro and
the wizard were left but somehow they managed to pull it off. I tried my
best to stay in melee with him and was doing quite well untill the cleric
had a fizzle. But then it was ouch time. As soon as i went, the Rogue was
next and followed by the Ranger. The cleric somehow managed to stay alive
for a while longer but couldnt handle the beating. When i finally made it
back the necro was at 1 quarter life and the wozard half. Talk about your
kick ass battle, Ill never forget it. When my friend who was just watching
sends me the screens, would any one like them?

Lothaniel/Rayne

> ----------
> From: suzkim@...[SMTP:suzkim@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Tuesday, June 15, 1999 8:27 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Warriors vs Hybrids
>
> From: suzkim@...
>
> Hi all,
>
> I wrote an e-mail to one of those guys from PPI - the ones who do the
> great
> analysis works of classs (see eq-stratis cleric for a sampling of their
> work). I
> told him of the things I have been reading here such as a critical strike
> (which
> he didn't think would be accepted), increase what bind wound could do ( he
> agreed that it should go up to 70-80%), increased skill cap (no comment
> from
> him) and unique warrior skill (again no comment from him). His idea was
> to have
> the warrior's defensives skill be increased some how. That would make the
> warrior harder to hit and therefore less damage and less down time.
>
> I am going to try to get him to join this mailing list since I feel he
> could
> give great insight. He did say that they were not going to be writing
> anything
> soon but said something about how a warrior could be tweeked to make a
> warrior
> awsome.
>
> Azlana
>
>
>
